name.description: Specifies the name of the Schedule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which the Schedule is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

automation_account_name.description: The name of the automation account in which the Schedule is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

frequency.description: The frequency of the schedule. - can be either `OneTime`, `Day`, `Hour`, `Week`, or `Month`.

interval.description: The number of `frequency`s between runs. Only valid when frequency is `Day`, `Hour`, `Week`, or `Month` and defaults to `1`.

start_time.description: Start time of the schedule. Must be at least five minutes in the future. Defaults to seven minutes in the future from the time the resource is created.

expiry_time.description: The end time of the schedule.

timezone.description: The timezone of the start time. Defaults to `UTC`. For possible values see: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms912391(v=winembedded.11).aspx

week_days.description: List of days of the week that the job should execute on. Only valid when frequency is `Week`.

month_days.description: List of days of the month that the job should execute on. Must be between `1` and `31`. `-1` for last day of the month. Only valid when frequency is `Month`.

monthly_occurrence.description: List of occurrences of days within a month. Only valid when frequency is `Month`. The `monthly_occurrence` block supports fields documented below.

day.description: Day of the occurrence. Must be one of `Monday`, `Tuesday`, `Wednesday`, `Thursday`, `Friday`, `Saturday`, `Sunday`.

occurrence.description: Occurrence of the week within the month. Must be between `1` and `5`. `-1` for last week within the month.

create.description: Used when creating the Automation Schedule.

update.description: Used when updating the Automation Schedule.

read.description: Used when retrieving the Automation Schedule.

delete.description: Used when deleting the Automation Schedule.
